Text.content:
Site plugins can add additional static resources such as CSS files, JavaScript files, or fonts to template JSPs for specific sites only.

If there are dozens of websites using your template and there is one specific website project that wants to add a frontend feature requiring a very large amount of JavaScript resources, for example, it is good practice to not statically include such site specific JavaScript resource in the template JSP, but provide them with the help of plugins.

A site plugin is a built-in configuration type. Its general configuration and usage in a template JSP is explained in the chapter about building template variants. The opencms-examples project on Github contains an example where a firework realized with HTML Canvas is shown on every page of a site.
